From the stack trace it looks like your Eclipse installation doesn't contain a plugin 'org.junit4_xxx'.
Can you verify this?
There should be a plugin yourEclipseInstall\eclipse\plugins\org.junit4_4.1.0.1

Do you have a special setup? Is it a gcj compiled version of Eclipse?

Indeed, I don't seem to have the junit4 plugin, only the junit3 plugin.
I compiled eclipse myself (or rather, Gentoo's package manager did it for me).
I probably have to convince it somehow to also compile the junit4 plugin.
This looks like a Gentoo problem rather than an Eclipse problem.

I found some threads on the Gentoo forums about this:

http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-t-519707-highlight-junit4.html
http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-t-510954-highlight-eclipse+junit.html

This explains it...
